page.title: 09EGGLESTONE ABBEY
page.content: Egglestone Abbey(ref:062,150) is situated above the River Tees on the south bank.It is a place well worth a visit, in beautiful surroundings and in easy walking distance of Barnard Castle. Entrance is free.Egglestone {Abbey}was one of the thirty_three Premonstratensian abbeys of St. Norbert and the home of the White Canons.It was built between 1195 and 1198 from local sandstone but was not properly finished until about 1475.The north and west walls still stand. Inside is the tomb of Sir Ralph Bowes of Streatlam and eight graves.On one is written: T.ROKEBY-JESU FOR YI(thy)PASSIONS SER (sore) BASTARDE-HAVE MERSI OF YI SINFUL HER (heir) The Canons were most hygenic as they had toilets flushed by Thorsgill Beck.
